intro: Vincetoxicum auritum, commonly known as the golden-weed or ear-leaved vincetoxicum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its stems are often hairy and can become woody with age. Vincetoxicum auritum is known for its ornamental value in gardens but can be invasive in certain regions.
